meanings.def: polite behaviour that shows respect for other people
examples: I was treated with the utmost courtesy by the staff.
We asked them, as a matter of courtesy, if we could photograph their house.
It's only common courtesy to tell the neighbours that we'll be having a party (= the sort of behaviour that people would expect).
He listened to all the complaints with great courtesy.
It's a matter of courtesy to write and thank people after a party.
It's common courtesy to give up your seat for elderly people.
It's common courtesy to warn your neighbours if your children are going to have a party.
She contacts clients regularly as a professional courtesy.
her unfailing courtesy to everyone
He bowed his head with exaggerated courtesy.
We asked them as a matter of courtesy.

meanings.def: a polite thing that you say or do when you meet people in formal situations
examples: an exchange of courtesies before the meeting
The prime minister was welcomed with the usual courtesies.

meanings.def: with the official permission of somebody/something and as a favour
examples: The pictures have been reproduced by courtesy of the British Museum.

meanings.def: given as a prize or provided free by a person or an organization
examples: Win a weekend in Rome, courtesy of Fiat.

meanings.def: as the result of a particular thing or situation
examples: Viewers can see the stadium from the air, courtesy of a camera fastened to the plane.

meanings.def: to be polite by doing the thing that is mentioned
examples: Please do me the courtesy of listening to what I'm saying.
She might have done me the courtesy of replying to my letter.

meanings.def: to know when you should do something in order to be polite
examples: You think he'd at least have the courtesy to call to say he'd be late.
You could at least have had the courtesy to let me know.

idioms.def: with the official permission of somebody/something and as a favour
examples: The pictures have been reproduced by courtesy of the British Museum.
Win a weekend in Rome, courtesy of Fiat.
Viewers can see the stadium from the air, courtesy of a camera fastened to the plane.

idioms.idiom: do somebody the courtesy of doing something
idioms.def: to be polite by doing the thing that is mentioned
examples: Please do me the courtesy of listening to what I'm saying.
She might have done me the courtesy of replying to my letter.

idioms.idiom: have the courtesy to do something
idioms.def: to know when you should do something in order to be polite
examples: You think he'd at least have the courtesy to call to say he'd be late.
You could at least have had the courtesy to let me know.

meanings.def: provided free, at no cost to the person using it
examples: A courtesy bus operates between the hotel and the beach.
The dealer will provide you with a courtesy car while your vehicle is being repaired.
